condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Learners/young people are afforded opportunities for effective learning, personal empowerment, active citizenship and/or employability in safe and inclusive environments

description.narrative: School-Related Gender-Based Violence (SRGBV) is addressed through upstream policy development and downstream capacity building of key personnel. (1) Skills building and empowerment of girls in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) field and (2) enhancing youth leadership through sport further afforded young people opportunities for effective learning, personal empowerment, active citizenship and employability in safe/inclusive environments. UNICEF played a critical role both in policy development and rolling out of the key interventions. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:07/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of key stakeholders (policy makers, NGOs, community members) reporting increased knowledge on how to take action on violence (bullying, xenophobia, corporal punishment, GBV) within school and community
System Strengthening - Gender - National education/training policies and plans support the mainstreaming of gender equity in opportunities for skills development - score (1-4), see guidance

Number of adolescents (girls and boys) who have completed at least one skills-building course (skills for life, learning and employability) during the last 12 months offered through formal or non-formal learning opportunities
Number of educators newly trained in a year on how to promote / offer Physical Education and Sports in schools and communities
